channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Spatio-Temporal Graph Mixformer for Traffic Forecasting
item.description: Additionally, we train an estimator model that express the contribution of a node over the desired prediction.

item.title: SimCKP: Simple Contrastive Learning of Keyphrase Representations
item.description: Keyphrase generation (KG) aims to generate a set of summarizing words or phrases given a source document, while keyphrase extraction (KE) aims to identify them from the text.

item.title: DualAug: Exploiting Additional Heavy Augmentation with OOD Data Rejection
item.description: Most existing data augmentation methods tend to find a compromise in augmenting the data, \textit{i. e.}, increasing the amplitude of augmentation carefully to avoid degrading some data too much and doing harm to the model performance.

item.title: Improving Fast Minimum-Norm Attacks with Hyperparameter Optimization
item.description: Evaluating the adversarial robustness of machine learning models using gradient-based attacks is challenging.

item.title: Defending Our Privacy With Backdoors
item.description: Our approach provides not only a new "dual-use" perspective on backdoor attacks, but also presents a promising avenue to enhance the privacy of individuals within models trained on uncurated web-scraped data.

item.title: Long-Tailed Classification Based on Coarse-Grained Leading Forest and Multi-Center Loss
item.description: In this method, we designed an unsupervised learning method, i. e., CLF, to better characterize the distribution of attributes within a class.

item.title: Unsupervised Learning of Object-Centric Embeddings for Cell Instance Segmentation in Microscopy Images
item.description: Here, we show theoretically that, under assumptions commonly found in microscopy images, OCEs can be learnt through a self-supervised task that predicts the spatial offset between image patches.

item.title: AutoVP: An Automated Visual Prompting Framework and Benchmark
item.description: To bridge this gap, we propose AutoVP, an end-to-end expandable framework for automating VP design choices, along with 12 downstream image-classification tasks that can serve as a holistic VP-performance benchmark.

item.title: UniPAD: A Universal Pre-training Paradigm for Autonomous Driving
item.description: In the context of autonomous driving, the significance of effective feature learning is widely acknowledged.

item.title: Impact of time and note duration tokenizations on deep learning symbolic music modeling
item.description: Symbolic music is widely used in various deep learning tasks, including generation, transcription, synthesis, and Music Information Retrieval (MIR).

item.title: Large Language Models for Scientific Synthesis, Inference and Explanation
item.description: We present a method for using general-purpose large language models to make inferences from scientific datasets of the form usually associated with special-purpose machine learning algorithms.

item.title: Neural Combinatorial Optimization with Heavy Decoder: Toward Large Scale Generalization
item.description: Neural combinatorial optimization (NCO) is a promising learning-based approach for solving challenging combinatorial optimization problems without specialized algorithm design by experts.

item.title: To token or not to token: A Comparative Study of Text Representations for Cross-Lingual Transfer
item.description: To understand the downstream implications of text representation choices, we perform a comparative analysis on language models having diverse text representation modalities including 2 segmentation-based models (\texttt{BERT}, \texttt{mBERT}), 1 image-based model (\texttt{PIXEL}), and 1 character-level model (\texttt{CANINE}).

item.title: MLP-AMDC: An MLP Architecture for Adaptive-Mask-based Dual-Camera snapshot hyperspectral imaging
item.description: In order to improve the inference speed of the reconstruction network, this paper proposes An MLP Architecture for Adaptive-Mask-based Dual-Camera (MLP-AMDC) to replace the transformer structure of the network.

item.title: Mapping Memes to Words for Multimodal Hateful Meme Classification
item.description: Multimodal image-text memes are prevalent on the internet, serving as a unique form of communication that combines visual and textual elements to convey humor, ideas, or emotions.

item.title: COVID-19 Detection Using Swin Transformer Approach from Computed Tomography Images
item.description: The accurate and efficient diagnosis of COVID-19 is of paramount importance, particularly in the context of large-scale medical imaging datasets.

item.title: Distilling from Vision-Language Models for Improved OOD Generalization in Vision Tasks
item.description: The client aims to minimize inference cost by distilling the VLM to a student model using the limited available task-specific data, and further deploying this student model in the downstream application.

item.title: UniPose: Detecting Any Keypoints
item.description: This work proposes a unified framework called UniPose to detect keypoints of any articulated (e. g., human and animal), rigid, and soft objects via visual or textual prompts for fine-grained vision understanding and manipulation.

item.title: Expanding the Vocabulary of BERT for Knowledge Base Construction
item.description: To address this, we present Vocabulary Expandable BERT for knowledge base construction, which expand the language model's vocabulary while preserving semantic embeddings for newly added words.

item.title: Can We Edit Multimodal Large Language Models?
item.description: In this paper, we focus on editing Multimodal Large Language Models (MLLMs).

item.title: X-HRNet: Towards Lightweight Human Pose Estimation with Spatially Unidimensional Self-Attention
item.description: Inspired by this observation, we introduce a lightweight and powerful alternative, Spatially Unidimensional Self-Attention (SUSA), to the pointwise (1x1) convolution that is the main computational bottleneck in the depthwise separable 3c3 convolution.

item.title: Generalized Logit Adjustment: Calibrating Fine-tuned Models by Removing Label Bias in Foundation Models
item.description: In this study, we systematically examine the biases in foundation models and demonstrate the efficacy of our proposed Generalized Logit Adjustment (GLA) method.

item.title: Learn From Model Beyond Fine-Tuning: A Survey
item.description: LFM focuses on the research, modification, and design of FM based on the model interface, so as to better understand the model structure and weights (in a black box environment), and to generalize the model to downstream tasks.

item.title: Simplicity Level Estimate (SLE): A Learned Reference-Less Metric for Sentence Simplification
item.description: Automatic evaluation for sentence simplification remains a challenging problem.

item.title: PonderV2: Pave the Way for 3D Foundataion Model with A Universal Pre-training Paradigm
item.description: In this paper, we introduce a comprehensive 3D pre-training framework designed to facilitate the acquisition of efficient 3D representations, thereby establishing a pathway to 3D foundational models.

item.title: Impact of multi-armed bandit strategies on deep recurrent reinforcement learning
item.description: We aim to show that adaptive stochastic methods for exploration better approximate the trade-off between exploration and exploitation as, in general, Softmax and Max-Boltzmann strategies are able to outperform epsilon-greedy techniques.

item.title: Counterfactual Explanations for Time Series Forecasting
item.description: In this paper, we formulate the novel problem of counterfactual generation for time series forecasting, and propose an algorithm, called ForecastCF, that solves the problem by applying gradient-based perturbations to the original time series.

item.title: Context Compression for Auto-regressive Transformers with Sentinel Tokens
item.description: The quadratic complexity of the attention module makes it gradually become the bulk of compute in Transformer-based LLMs during generation.

item.title: Semantic-Forward Relaying: A Novel Framework Towards 6G Cooperative Communications
item.description: This letter proposes a novel relaying framework, semantic-forward (SF), for cooperative communications towards the sixth-generation (6G) wireless networks.

item.title: HoneyBee: Progressive Instruction Finetuning of Large Language Models for Materials Science
item.description: We propose an instruction-based process for trustworthy data curation in materials science (MatSci-Instruct), which we then apply to finetune a LLaMa-based language model targeted for materials science (HoneyBee).

item.title: Towards a Unified Analysis of Kernel-based Methods Under Covariate Shift
item.description: Two types of covariate shift problems are the focus of this paper and the sharp convergence rates are established for a general loss function to provide a unified theoretical analysis, which concurs with the optimal results in literature where the squared loss is used.

item.title: Extensions of Heterogeneity in Integration and Prediction (HIP) with R Shiny Application
item.description: Multiple data views measured on the same set of participants is becoming more common and has the potential to deepen our understanding of many complex diseases by analyzing these different views simultaneously.

item.title: Infinite Width Graph Neural Networks for Node Regression/ Classification
item.description: This work analyzes Graph Neural Networks, a generalization of Fully-Connected Deep Neural Nets on Graph structured data, when their width, that is the number of nodes in each fullyconnected layer is increasing to infinity.

item.title: Model-Agnostic Covariate-Assisted Inference on Partially Identified Causal Effects
item.description: Finally, we propose an efficient computational framework, enabling implementation on many practical problems in causal inference.

item.title: Language Models are Universal Embedders
item.description: As such cases span from English to other natural or programming languages, from retrieval to classification and beyond, it is desirable to build a unified embedding model rather than dedicated ones for each scenario.

item.title: XIMAGENET-12: An Explainable AI Benchmark Dataset for Model Robustness Evaluation
item.description: The lack of standardized robustness metrics and the widespread reliance on numerous unrelated benchmark datasets for testing have created a gap between academically validated robust models and their often problematic practical adoption.

item.title: Not All Demonstration Examples are Equally Beneficial: Reweighting Demonstration Examples for In-Context Learning
item.description: To assess the quality of weights in the absence of additional validation data, we design a masked self-prediction (MSP) score that exhibits a strong correlation with the final ICL performance.

item.title: The Uncertainty-based Retrieval Framework for Ancient Chinese CWS and POS
item.description: Automatic analysis for modern Chinese has greatly improved the accuracy of text mining in related fields, but the study of ancient Chinese is still relatively rare.

item.title: MProto: Multi-Prototype Network with Denoised Optimal Transport for Distantly Supervised Named Entity Recognition
item.description: Distantly supervised named entity recognition (DS-NER) aims to locate entity mentions and classify their types with only knowledge bases or gazetteers and unlabeled corpus.

item.title: Incorporating Domain Knowledge Graph into Multimodal Movie Genre Classification with Self-Supervised Attention and Contrastive Learning
item.description: Firstly we retrieve the relevant embedding from the knowledge graph by utilizing group relations in metadata and then integrate it with other modalities.

item.title: GraphextQA: A Benchmark for Evaluating Graph-Enhanced Large Language Models
item.description: The proposed dataset is designed to evaluate graph-language models' ability to understand graphs and make use of it for answer generation.

item.title: Visual Question Generation in Bengali
item.description: Our quantitative and qualitative results establish the first state of the art models for VQG task in Bengali and demonstrate that our models are capable of generating grammatically correct and relevant questions.

item.title: ZEST: Attention-based Zero-Shot Learning for Unseen IoT Device Classification
item.description: Recent research works have proposed machine learning models for classifying IoT devices connected to a network.

item.title: Core-sets for Fair and Diverse Data Summarization
item.description: We consider two natural diversity measures: sum-of-pairwise distances and sum-of-nearest-neighbor distances, and show improved core-set construction algorithms with respect to these measures.

item.title: Rethinking Negative Pairs in Code Search
item.description: In our proposed loss function, we apply three methods to estimate the weights of negative pairs and show that the vanilla InfoNCE loss is a special case of Soft-InfoNCE.

item.title: Visual Data-Type Understanding does not emerge from Scaling Vision-Language Models
item.description: This finding points to a blind spot in current frontier VLMs: they excel in recognizing semantic content but fail to acquire an understanding of visual \textit{data-types} through scaling.

item.title: Interpretable Diffusion via Information Decomposition
item.description: For diffusion models, we show that a natural non-negative decomposition of mutual information emerges, allowing us to quantify informative relationships between words and pixels in an image.

item.title: Transport-Hub-Aware Spatial-Temporal Adaptive Graph Transformer for Traffic Flow Prediction
item.description: Finally, we design an extra spatial-temporal knowledge distillation module for incremental learning of traffic flow prediction tasks.

item.title: Lag-Llama: Towards Foundation Models for Time Series Forecasting
item.description: Aiming to build foundation models for time-series forecasting and study their scaling behavior, we present here our work-in-progress on Lag-Llama, a general-purpose univariate probabilistic time-series forecasting model trained on a large collection of time-series data.

item.title: MetaBox: A Benchmark Platform for Meta-Black-Box Optimization with Reinforcement Learning
item.description: To fill this gap, we introduce MetaBox, the first benchmark platform expressly tailored for developing and evaluating MetaBBO-RL methods.
